p: In Jakarta, many factors might increase the flood vulnerability, such as people living in flood-prone areas, limited access to safe drinking water and sanitation, improper urban infrastructure planning, and a lack of waste management [ 103, 104]. Furthermore, an excessive use of ground water that triggers land subsidence is also another ongoing problem in Jakarta [ 36, 105]. Previous authors have confirmed that lack of community awareness of flood risks has made Jakarta more vulnerable to flooding.
